title: Player Substitution in the event of AFK.
body:
Not sure if this has been mentioned before, but after having played so many games in ranked where the experience of 4 players is completely ruined and negatively impacted by trolls or people who intentionally AFK I am wondering if this idea might help? 

So basically it would work like this; you register as a substitute and if in a ranked game a player AFK's/leaves it would start a timer. After say 2 minutes (enough time for them to have logged back it if it was a accident or unfortunate D/C) players who have selected the "Substitute" option get a notice to enter the game playing as the champion who AFK'ed. It would provide you a short overview of the scores and game time and you could enter the game and take over the champion.

Now in order for people to actually want to do this there needs to be some kind of incentive. So I would suggest that perhaps there is no LP penalty in terms of lost points for a substitute player and yet if their team wins they get a percentage of the LP based on the time since they took over the champ. Obviously the player who AFK'ed would still receive their LP loss.

My biggest issue with ranked games is losing LP purely because a played D/C'ed, and sure it happens but this is a way to do something about it.

Riot could even offer special rewards for substitutes like a banner, icons, maybe an end of season reward if you subbed a particular number of games in the season.

I am sure there is a lot of technical stuff to be considered in terms of match making and how this might affect ranked games but personally id rather have a substitute come into my game then have to play the next 15-30 minutes with 4v5.


What do people think?

replies.body:
Alright
---
First off this has been mentioned before a while back but here is my opinions.
1) Great Concept... Although it would be hard to find a balanced player to the one who just left
2) Since there is no LP loss players could go and feed as there are no consequences to there actions. (Sure you could report but you still lose LP right)
3) Smurfs... Speaks for itself
And something else how would Player "X" get the option to substitute for Player "Y" who just AFK'ed, would it be an option in the menu screen or something or other
---
Awesome Concept hard to execute
(Just my thoughts)

You could also play substitute only and rank up indefinitely, granted it might take longer.

Would I play as a substitute in this system? Yes I would. However I think the poll should be asking our opinions on if we think the system is good/flawed, not if we would use it in that state.

-- A simple solution for all game modes would be to activate an intermediate bot (group focused) to alleviate some pressure. Although the AI likely needs some tweaking to be a reasonable substitute.

> 2) Since there is no LP loss players could go and feed as there are no consequences to there actions. (Sure you could report but you still lose LP right)

My main reason for putting no.

Not to mention by time most people are AFKing (except for actual problems/emergency's) the game is beyond lost, so sure there is no loss, but there is relatively no gains at the same time.
